title: Bordi Beach
subtitle: Tranquil shores, chikoo orchards, and cultural heritage
overview: Bordi Beach is a tranquil and lesser-known coastal destination located in the Dahanu region of Maharashtra, near the Gujarat border. It features a long, clean shoreline lined with chikoo orchards and is known for its peaceful and unspoiled charm.

The beach offers a flat stretch of sand, gentle waves, and safe swimming areas, making it ideal for family outings and quiet retreats. The surrounding area has Parsi and Warli cultural influences, giving Bordi a unique historical and ethnic flavor.

Its proximity to Mumbai (approximately 145 km) makes it an easy weekend getaway. The area is also famous for its annual Chikoo Festival and eco-tourism initiatives that promote local art, farming, and sustainable travel.

highlights.title: Chikoo Orchards
highlights.description: Rows of fruit-bearing chikoo trees line the village around the beach, offering agro-tourism experiences.

highlights.title: Secluded Shore
highlights.description: Long, uncrowded beach perfect for solitude, reading, or nature walks.

geography.intro: Bordi Beach lies in the northern coastal belt of Maharashtra, nestled between Dahanu and the Gujarat border. The beach is surrounded by lush chikoo orchards and traditional villages.

climate.description: Bordi enjoys a mild tropical coastal climate with hot summers, green monsoons, and pleasant winters. The best time to visit is between November and February.

geography.conclusion: The flat terrain, chikoo groves, and undeveloped coastline make Bordi ideal for eco-tourism and slow travel.

activities.title: Beach Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks along the long stretch of clean, black-sand beach surrounded by casuarina trees.
info: Best during morning or sunset hours
Ideal for families and solo travelers

attractions.title: Bahrot Caves
attractions.description: Historic rock-cut caves with Zoroastrian significance, located about 10 km from Bordi.

marineLife.intro: Bordi Beach, while not known for deep-sea marine biodiversity, features a coastal ecosystem enriched by tidal waves and organic agriculture nearby.

items.title: Shoreline Fish
items.description: Small fish and crabs can be seen during low tide across wet sand and rock pools.

conclusion: The marine zone around Bordi promotes nature-based tourism with minimal environmental impact.
Its balance of farming and nature makes it an educational destination for families and eco-lovers.
